item.title: Pollution from local Landry, 21st August
item.description:
Masses of polystyrene beads and fluff from tumble dryers (possibly from local laundry) have spoiled and are blowing around various areas near Coronation Square. Especially bad near The Oasis and in the Coronation Square car park. If you catch it soon, it might not have blown all over town!

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping at entrance to park Hanover St, 21st August
item.description:
Lots of large cardboard boxes Flytipped next to the bin at the entrance to Pittville Park from Hanover St. also nearby, pieces of wood Flytipped on the pavement against the fence of 85 Marle Marle Hill Road (Hanover St side). Given recent arson events nearby, please can these be removed promptly

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag tied to streetlight, 21st August
item.description:
Union flag tied to streetlight, just below the lantern. Possibly obscuring beam. Post number 1 on Courtenay Street, outside number 47

Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Incomplete/abandoned park, 20th August
item.description:
An open space in Brockworth, opposite the David Lloyds club car parking entrance, had works started on it to install outdoor gym equipment and some seating. It however seems incomplete with random apparatus left about and rubbish I assumed the builders would have removed. Their were gates that had cornered the park off but one side is bent and moved, which has led to the one the other side being removed for easier access. I have seen multiple children playing in this unfinished area and am concerned for their safety. I would appreciate this area being completed and or properly made safe until it can be completed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golf Club Lane, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
